content:
Hey, folks. I submitted this PR https://github.com/rust-lang/rfcs/pull/3013 for an RFC for a compiler feature (verifying the correct usage of #[cfg]). After an initial round of feedback (largely positive, and I've made edits to reflect feedback), it looks like no one is reviewing this.

It's been 2 weeks now. Could someone look at this? Or let me know when this might advance?
Tagging @scottmcm , since you were mentioned in the PR thread.
I've marked it T-lang, and nominated for discussion at our next triage meeting.
Thanks. Partly I'm doing this RFC as a way to learn the RFC process. Are the triage meetings open to the public?
(Based on the statement that it's a lang issue.)
yes, triage is open to the public and posted on youtube. https://lang-team.rust-lang.org/meetings.html
Hmm, I wonder where the appropriate home for this is. Part of the trouble with this one is that it looks like it cross-cuts cargo and compiler and lang, in a way.
I'll join in, in case anyone has any questions about this.

As you say, "Language semantics are unchanged", so lang's involvement is probably only whether the lint would push people to write their code in a way that's not a direction we'd want, but I don't think that's really the case with this one.

I'll tag it Cargo too.
